Class XPathApplicator

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.xml.XPathApplicator

public class XPathApplicator
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class to cache and apply xpaths.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Constructor Detail

XPathApplicator

public XPathApplicator()
Method Detail

getXPath

public XPath getXPath(java.lang.String patternString)
Get the cached (or create and cache) xpath for the given pattern.

If the pattern string includes an attribute, the attribute is ignored.

getNodes

public java.util.List<Tree<XmlLite.Data>> getNodes(java.lang.String patternString,
                                                   Tree<XmlLite.Data> node)
Get the nodes that match this xpath pattern string starting from the given node. If the patternString includes an attribute (i.e. is of the form "xpath@attribute"), then only those nodes that have the given attribute (possibly empty) will be included in the result.

Note: subscripts are ignored for the first element in the path.

Returns:
the matching node(s) or null.

getFirstNode

public Tree<XmlLite.Data> getFirstNode(java.lang.String patternString,
                                       Tree<XmlLite.Data> node)
Convenience method for getting the first matching node against this xpath. If the patternString includes an attribute (i.e. is of the form "xpath@attribute"), then the first node among those having the given attribute matching the xpath will be returned.

getText

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getText(java.lang.String patternString,
                                                Tree<XmlLite.Data> node,
                                                boolean all)
Apply this xpath pattern to the given node, extracting the text under each matching node. All text under a matching node is concatenated. Text is trimmed and concatenation adds a single space delimiter between texts. If the patternString includes an attribute (i.e. is of the form "xpath@attribute", then only text from nodes matching the xpath that have the given attribute will be returned.

NOTE: empty text nodes will be ignored.

Parameters:
patternString - The xpath pattern with an optional attribute.
node - The node to apply this xpath from.
all - If all, get all (deep) text under the node; otherwise, just get text immediately under the node.
Returns:
null if no nodes match the pattern; empty if nodes match, but they contain no (non-empty) text; or the strings of texts found under each matching nodes.

getText

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getText(java.lang.String patternString,
                                                Tree<XmlLite.Data> node,
                                                boolean all,
                                                boolean includeEmpties)
Apply this xpath pattern to the given node, extracting the text under each matching node. All text under a matching node is concatenated. Text is trimmed and concatenation adds a single space delimiter between texts. If the patternString includes an attribute (i.e. is of the form "xpath@attribute", then only text from nodes matching the xpath that have the given attribute will be returned.

Parameters:
patternString - The xpath pattern with an optional attribute.
node - The node to apply this xpath from.
all - If all, get all (deep) text under the node; otherwise, just get text immediately under the node.
includeEmpties - If true, empty text nodes will appear with empty strings as placeholders; otherwise, empty text nodes will be ignored.
Returns:
null if no nodes match the pattern; empty if nodes match, but they contain no (non-empty) text; or the strings of texts found under each matching nodes.

getAllText

public java.lang.String getAllText(java.lang.String patternString,
                                   Tree<XmlLite.Data> node,
                                   java.lang.String delim)
Get all (deep) text under the node, concatenating using the given delim as a single string.

Parameters:
patternString - the xpath pattern to apply.
node - the node to which to apply the pattern.
delim - the delimiter to use when concatenating multiple strings.

getFirstText

public java.lang.String getFirstText(java.lang.String patternString,
                                     Tree<XmlLite.Data> node)
Convenience method for getting the first matching node's text. If the patternString includes an attribute (i.e. is of the form "xpath@attribute"), then the text from the first node among those having the given attribute matching the xpath will be returned.

getText

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getText(java.lang.String patternString,
                                                Tree<XmlLite.Data> node,
                                                java.lang.String attribute)
Apply this xpath pattern to the given node, extracting attribute values from the results matching the given attribute. If the patternString includes an attribute (i.e. is of the form "xpath@attribute"), then the attribute in the patternString is ignored.

Parameters:
node - The node to apply this xpath from.
attribute - The attribute whose values are to be collected.
Returns:
null if no nodes match the pattern; empty list if nodes match and the attribute exists, but is empty; or the attribute values found in matching nodes.

getFirstText

public java.lang.String getFirstText(java.lang.String patternString,
                                     Tree<XmlLite.Data> node,
                                     java.lang.String attribute)
Convenience method for getting the first matching node's attribute value. If the patternString includes an attribute (i.e. is of the form "xpath@attribute"), then the attribute in the patternString is ignored.

setText

public java.util.List<Tree<XmlLite.Data>> setText(java.lang.String patternString,
                                                  Tree<XmlLite.Data> node,
                                                  java.lang.String text,
                                                  boolean firstOnly)
Set the text for the nodes found or created through the pattern. If the patternString ends in an attribute, set the attribute's value.

Returns:
the found or created nodes.

splitPatternAttribute

public static final java.lang.String[] splitPatternAttribute(java.lang.String patternString)
Split the given patternString such that the xpath is in result[0]. If the patternString includes an attribute of the form "xpath@attribute", then return the attribute in result[1].

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Throws:
java.io.IOException
